newsitem.title: LATVIA: Latvian shares pulled down by Daugavpils. [CORRECTED 13:40 GMT]
newsitem.headline: Latvian shares pulled down by Daugavpils. [CORRECTED 13:40 GMT]

text.p: Latvian shares erased recent gains in sluggish trade on Friday as Daugavpils Chain's price fell steeply because it went ex-bonus, dealers said.
The Rietumu index lost 5.98 points to close at 181.24 (corrects closing price) and overall market volume was a paltry 40,000 lats.
Daugavpils Chain saw its price fall to 1.17 lats to 2.15 lats in trade of 7,600 lats.
"We can basically say the price is the same as yesterday only adjusted to the bonus share issue volume," said Roberts Idelsons, head of Trasta Bank's securities department.
The company, a leading secondary list stock, earlier issued some seven million bonus shares or 84 shares per head.
"The Daugavpils fall took the market by surprise, and may explain why things were so inactive today," said one dealer.
Another dealer said the listless mood was partly explained by the fact that it was the last trading session of the month and brokers were tidying their books.
Of the five shares on the official list, one was not quoted, two held steady and two eased.
Unibanka fell 6.8 percent to 3.31 lats in trade of 1,600 lats.
"Unibanka rose a little too high and too fast...it should stabilise now," said one broker.
